data.title: Maria Helena de Moura Neves
data.text:
Brazilian linguist (1931–2022)

Maria Helena de Moura Neves (31 January 1931 – 17 December 2022) was a Brazilian linguist known for her work on language use, especially functional approaches to Portuguese grammar.[2][3][4] She also conducted research on the history and teaching of grammar.[5] She was professor emerita at São Paulo State University, and also lectured at Mackenzie Presbyterian University.[6] In 2022 she received the Ester Sabino Award in the Senior Researcher category.[7]

Moura Neves died of a stroke in Araraquara, São Paulo, on 17 December 2022, at the age of 91.[8]
